Where to Send Questions About Fugitive Felons
Use the table below to determine where to send questions on fugitive felon issues.
If ...
Then ...
the question relates to procedures for handling fugitive felon cases
e-mail the question to
VAVBAWAS/CO/212
(VSCs/BESTs), or
VAVBAWAS/CO/P&F TNG QUAL OVRST
(PMCs).
an RO has a question that
relates to the
facts
of a specific case, and
cannot be resolved from the evidence of record, and/or
the RO is having difficulty obtaining or understanding information from a court or law enforcement agency
send an e-mail to
VAVBAWAS/CO/212
with the Veteran’s name, SSN or claim number, a concise summary of the known facts, and the issue to be resolved (VSCs/BESTs), or
OIG (
OIG51FugitiveFelonHQ@va.gov
), including
VAVBAWAS/CO/P&F TNG QUAL OVRST
in the Cc line, that provides a concise summary of the known facts and the issue to be resolved (PMCs).
Note
:  OIG can often get information that local law enforcement authorities will only release to other members of law enforcement.
there is uncertainty as to whether or not it would be appropriate to send a question to
OIG
e-mail the question to
VAVBAWAS/CO/212
(VSCs/BESTs), or
VAVBAWAS/CO/P&F TNG QUAL OVRST
(PMCs).
Reference
:  For more information on when to address questions directly to the OIG corporate mailbox, see
M21-1, Part XIV, 8.3.d
.
